context_of_use: This use case allows an admin to configure application settings and system parameters for customization and operation.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control system settings for effective operation.
description: This use case enables admins to configure application settings and system parameters for customization and operation.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to configure system settings.
postconditions: System settings are updated according to admin specifications.
assumptions: The admin has valid credentials to access the system.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to configure system settings.
The system shall authenticate admins before allowing configuration.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on specific settings available for configuration.
main_flow: 1. Admin initiates the configuration process → System prompts for authentication.
2. Admin provides authentication credentials → System verifies credentials.
3. System confirms successful authentication → Admin accesses configuration settings.
4. Admin modifies system settings → System saves the updated settings.
5. System confirms settings have been updated → Admin receives confirmation message.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the admin fails to authenticate, the system displays an error message and prompts for re-entry of credentials.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the system fails to verify credentials, the system displays an error message and denies access to configuration settings.
